intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. molybdochroum, commonly known as the dark hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a rosette growth form with basal leaves and is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-rich soils. The subspecies molybdochroum is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and coloration.
